name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

strengths: Stretch Kick snipes benched Pokemon for 20 damage
High Jump Kick does solid 50 damage
Fighting type hits many Pokemon for weakness
weaknesses: 60 HP is low for a main attacker
Psychic weakness is problematic against popular Psychic Pokemon
Stretch Kick requires opponent to have benched Pokemon
synergies: Plus Power (push High Jump Kick to 60)
Gust of Wind (bring damaged bench Pokemon active)
counters: Mr. Mime's Invisible Wall blocks High Jump Kick
Higher HP Pokemon can tank the attacks

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Hitmonlee is functionally identical to the holo version (#7). Hitmonlee's Stretch Kick provided a unique bench-sniping ability that complemented spread damage strategies. The non-holo printing made it more accessible for competitive players.

rulings.ruling: Stretch Kick can only be used if your opponent has at least one Benched Pokemon.
Stretch Kick does not damage the Active Pokemon at all - only a Benched Pokemon.
Weakness and Resistance are not applied to Stretch Kick's bench damage.
High Jump Kick is affected normally by Weakness and Resistance when targeting the Active Pokemon.
